Gaudy plastic banner advertisment banner for an event in Ashburton Park, in the LB of Croydon, flyposted on the attractive railings of the Croydon Rd frontage of Croydon Rd Rec (aka Beckenham Rec). Near the double gates / park keeper's house.

item.title: Two 'We are family' music gig plastic banners affixed to the attractive park railings by the grand park gates and listed park keeper's house, Beckenham Rec (aka Croydon Rd Rec)., 29th August
item.description:
Two 'We are family' music gig plastic banners affixed to the attractive park railings by the grand park gates and listed park keeper's house, Beckenham Rec (aka Croydon Rd Rec). I disagree with turning the railings into a linear advertisement hoarding, however Bromley Council has permitted a park event advert then one will do.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 319, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackwall Tunnel Approach, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Park name board removed and scruffy board visible, Croydon Rd Rec, Beckenham, 29th August
item.description:
Park name board removed and an even older scruffy sign left visible. Please remove. This makes a poor impression on entering the lovely park. The Listed Park Keeper's House and the newly refurbished Edwardian Banstand are nearby. There are many tacky plastic advertisement banners cable-tied to the attractive park railings spoiling the green frontage and setting of the double gates and park keeper's cottage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 319, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 29th August
item.description:
Graffiti needs to be removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Montague Place, 29th August
item.description:
The street nameplate on the corner of Montague Place, next to the junction with Gower Street - the red W1 letters are peeling off. Can the street nameplate here be replaced please ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Bedford Square, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flower pots wired to bench in Croydon Rd Rec, 29th August
item.description:
A bench in Croydon Rd Recreation Ground (aka Beckenham Rec) has two flower pots affixed to it with metal strip and wires near the arms making it impossible to use for those elderly or infirm persons requiring the aid of the arms to sit down and stand up. The pots will not be visible to a blind person sitting down. I would have thought that the conditions of donating a bench were limited to the display of a memorial dedication plate. Please secure the removal of these flowerpots. The bench is a Croydon Rd gate nearest Whitmore Rd adjoining the petrol station. The dedication plate names are Vinni and Valli. As an elderly person with joint pains and mobility problems, I was unable to sit at this nearest bench to the gate and struggled painfully to the next bench. Memorial benches need to be usable by all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fire, 29th August
item.description:
Someone set the rubbish on fire in the alleyway on Friday 29/08/2025 at 20:10 in the evening. The fire brigade came and put it out and said they are going to send a report of how dangerous it is. Being so close to the back of shops and houses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 257, Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Graffiti on the wall of a Grade II Listed property, 29th August
item.description:

item.title: Water discharge, 29th August
item.description:
From the side extension to 9 Tunstock Way, the two downpipes from the guttering discharge directly onto the small stretch of pavement, and then into the road where there is no drain. Is this allowed? One section of the pavement seems to have suffered already, sinking and broken with weeds growing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tunstock Way, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weedkilling required on pavement, 29th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heathlee Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Where indicated but not just here, 29th August
item.description:
Chatsworth Rd between Mapesbury rd and Christchurch Avenue has not been swept this week. A lot of leaves litter throughout but especialy at this location indicated opposite bowls club Thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mapesbury Road, London
